name: Livia Z Yanez
body:
### Welcome 
This page contains links to some of the projects I worked on over the last few years. The main goal of my PhD research was to improve success rates and clinical outcomes after _in vitro_ fertilization (IVF) through better prediction of embryo viability. 

Toward this goal, I noninvasively gathered optical and biomechanical data about embryos at various stages of development and built a model to accurately identify those with high viability. I then used this model to understand what goes wrong at the molecular level when an embryo fails to develop successfully.


### Projects
The projects are listed below. You can also view the code for each project on my GitHub profile @liviaz. 

1. [Predicting egg and embryo viability based on measurements of their optical and biomechanical properties](https://liviaz.github.io/EmbryoProject)

2. [Identifying patterns of gene expression associated with high developmental potential](https://liviaz.github.io/RnaSeqAnalysis)

3. [Assessing freezing-induced damage on embryos based on automated image analysis](https://liviaz.github.io/OCTImageProcessing)

4. [Modeling embryo development as a partially observable Markov decision process (POMDP)](https://liviaz.github.io/EmbryoCulturePOMDP)

5. [Automated measurement of embryo biomechanical properties](https://liviaz.github.io/PressureSystem)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
